review.title: Very contemporary, high-end hotel

There always seems to be a special event going on there--some party, wedding, or other celebration in which people are all dressed up.  I always enjoy people watching there and it gives other guests the sense that they are at a very special place, since so many choose it for important celebrations.  This weekend there was a wedding and I so enjoyed watching the photographs being taken out by the ocean.

review.title: Wonderful experience!
review.reviewText:
Great stay!  From our initial experience of arrival and dropping off our car to the valet (a very friendly gentlemen welcomed us and took care of the car quickly), to a pleasant gentlemen at the desk who answered all of our questions & checked us in quickly (we did have reservations for our 3 day stay), to other hotel staff who were all smiles and acknowledged us as we arrived and got our luggage to the elevator.  Beautiful room, great views of the waterfront and arriving and departing flight at SFO.
Surprisingly quiet, giving the proximity to the airport.  Clean, spacious, and well-appointed comfy room.   Our experiences at Hangar Steak for both dinner and breakfast were wonderful.  Expertly prepared steaks (tried the filet.  Best I've EVER eaten). My wife had the free-range chicken with root veggies.  She thought it was AMAZING.  Local produce was used, and it's SO fresh!!   The breakfast buffet was also beyond awesome.   Also, we appreciated having a dog relief station right out back for our service dog, complete with baggies.  All staff members ROCK!  Awesome folks, truly!  Marriot just GETS the concept of hospitality. We'll be staying here again very soon!

review.title: A standout in interior design and comfort
review.reviewText:
I travel a lot and I love this hotel.  They have invested heavily in keeping it contemporary with strict attention to the comfort of their guests.  The lobby itself is so visually appealing with beauty everywhere in terms of the interior design.  Sometimes after I check in, I just stand there and take in the artistry in the lobby.  I want their interior designer for my office and my home!   The shuttle service to the airport is excellent, too, running every 10 minutes.  I'd recommend allowing some extra time, as the shuttle stops at another hotel on the way to the airport.
My only suggestion for improvement of this hotel is to have longer hours for the Starbucks that is in the lobby.   During the time I stood there taking in the beauty, I saw several people go up to the Starbucks near the reception desk and then be a bit surprised that it was closed.   I know I felt the same way.   It forces people to purchase items from the hotel "gift shop" and a pint container of Haagen-Daz ice cream costs $7.  More options would be great.  But overall, this place is awesome.  They really extend themselves to create excellence in the guest experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Beauty of the lobby and rooms; courtesy of staff; proximity to outside of the hotel options for dining; shuttle service;
review.negativeRemarks: Keep Starbucks open earlier and later; If that isn't an option, lower the prices of the items the hotel sells.

review.title: Beware the holding fee
review.reviewText: The hotel facility is nice, but we had a bad experience due to their credit card holding fee. Apparently this is a practice for Marriott, and you can find a Washington Post story about it. I wish I had known before we booked. I doubt we'll ever book Marriott again. They will place a holding fee on your card equal to your total charge plus an additional amount. Unfortunately for us, they charged the holding fee twice and when the final charge was put through, the holding fees didn't come off. So we wound up with around $1,750 of pending charges for a two-night stay, which maxed out the credit card during the middle of our travel. Instead of enjoying our vacation, we had to spend time talking to the Marriott accountant and the credit card company trying to get the issue resolved so that we could continue traveling. If you're traveling on a tight budget and are relying on your credit card, you may want to ask about the hotel's holding fee practice before booking.
review.positiveRemarks: The facility is nice. Even though it's close to the airport, the room was quiet. Shuttle to the airport made it convenient.
review.negativeRemarks: Change the holding fee practice. Need to inform guests when checking in just how much their card will be charged.

review.title: Perfect airport hotel
review.reviewText: I had a room with a waterfront view which I highly recommend.  It didn't cost much more than the standard room and it was so nice to look out over the water and watch the planes arrive and take off.  I got a glimpse of the other hotels in the area and this one seemed to be most directly located on the water versus others that were separated by a parking lot or other buildings.  There is a nice walkway along the water directly in front of the hotel and the hotel has a patio area with comfy lounge chairs, lanterns and fire pits for outdoor relaxing.  The night I was there the hotel offered a complimentary luau happy hour with drinks, snacks and live music on the patio.  The room and bathroom were great.  There was a large flat screen TV wall-mounted between the two beds and all the usual higher-end amenities.  Only complaint about the bathroom is the addition of more towel hooks and/or racks - especially if the hotel would like guests to re-use their towels.  There isn't much in the surrounding area to see/shop but the hotel has a timely, complimentary shuttle to/from the metro station.  All of the staff I encountered were friendly and professional.
review.positiveRemarks: View, large screen TV, location on the water, outdoor seating area, employees.
review.negativeRemarks: More places to hang bath towels.

review.reviewText: Typical Marriott:  rooms are plain, bathrooms small and plain.  Our air conditioning did not work, and the windows to the outside could not open.  Upon arrival, no bellman offered to help us with our luggage.  On the plus side, the room temperature was okay, not hot (could have been cooler), restaurant downstairs for breakfast was good if expensive, and there was a Starbucks in the lobby.  I give it three points out of five.  Next time I'll try another nearby hotel.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for sharing your experience with us. We are very disappointed to learn that you did not enjoy a five-star experience at our property, and we sincerely apologize for lack of attention to your guest room. Rest assured that we will be addressing this matter with the appropriate management team in an effort to prevent this instance from occurring in the future. Thank you again for your candid feedback. review.title: Gross!!!!!
review.reviewText: When I called about deplorable conditions in bathroom, they apologized and ASKED what they could do for me. They informed me in would be a half hour or more to move me to another room as they had no rooms available, they were still cleaning rooms.  Declined offer as I arrived approx. 4:30 pm. and had a 5:30 pm appointment. Bathroom had long black hair on floor and around toilet, specks of stuff on floor, back specks on inside toilet rim, curly black hair on rim of bathtub...and long black hair on door jam.  Gross!   I asked they send housekeeper to clean bathroom.  She told me she didn't see anything.  She informed me bathroom had been cleaned and spec's were flaws in tile.  I really didn't see her do any housekeeping service... I really didn't even notice if she swept floor!  It was a totally gross experience and  had a knot in my stomach just thinking about it -I  felt less than clean being in that room.  I was happy only needed to spend one night there!  Happy to get out of there! They gave me a $30 credit to use for food at their hotel ...and their apology.
review.positiveRemarks: nice view of airplanes taxing on landing by waters edge.

Clean your rooms - Get new towel - or wash them better -smelled gross!
Cigar butts in potted plant container -clean your facility!

review.title: Nice location, but hated the parking charge of $25

I have never stayed at a Marriott where they have run out of any appliance.

review.title: Excellent restaurant and waterfront ambience
review.reviewText:
We booked one night for a short couple's getaway.    Despite an initial hiccup with our room assignment, my wife thoroughly enjoyed her stay.   In particular, she truly enjoyed her experiences at the Landing restaurant for both dinner and breakfast.   She was greatly impressed by the atmosphere and decor as well as the first-rate service.   The breakfast buffet was not just about quantity of choice, but the quality of the selections from juices to cheeses and cold cuts were truly impressive.   The waitstaff were incredibily attentive and polite.  In my wife's own words, she felt like: "We were in a different world".      
The walk afterward dinner and breakfast along the waterfront also made a grand impression upon both of us.   We certainly will plan on another couple's getaway, in the near future.
review.positiveRemarks: The restaurant was first-class in every way.  The waitstaff, in particular, were attentive and polite.

review.title: Ok, but not worth the amount paid
review.reviewText:
I arrived at the hotel with my keys immediately taken from me by the valet folks so that I could check in. Upon checking in, the teammate was a little short and curt with me (the hotel was quite busy and noisy as a conference had ended) as I presented my debit card for incidentals. This sounds so silly, but I felt like a lower class citizen because I chose to use my debit rather than credit card. I couldn't use the key to enter the self parking, they had forgotten to code it even though the teammate asked me 3 different times when checking in if I would be self parking. The white button to use for assistance was not working so I went back and they re-coded my key. 

The room was clean, nice. Typical Marriott fashion. The carpet was wet next to the closet, I reported this as it stayed wet the entire time I was there (2 days) but no one showed up to take a look. I assumed they thought this was normal.

review.title: Nice hotel with great access to the airport
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this hotel twice a year for nearly a decade. I appreciate the close proximity to some restaurants and, of course, the location near the water. I've always found the staff very well trained and professional. The dÃ©cor is contemporary and has a lot of artistry in the design.
review.positiveRemarks: Good room service food and efficiency; dependable shuttle to the airport; courteous staff; beautiful lobby dÃ©cor.
review.locationRemarks: There is a Mexican restaurant and an Elephant Walk restaurant within walking distance.

review.title: Tires on the beach
review.reviewText: Well, overall things where better than bad, we had to pay $20.00 extra per day for view to the water which look more like a pond with 2 tires and dirty water, that was not nice! We went to eat to the restaurant and I ask for a window table and I was told they were reserved but there where others that were not so that wasn't nice either the food was good the waitress and the waiter were very nice excellent service! Our room was nicely clean, the bed comfortable, the linens were soft and clean. Most people were nice just the hostess at the restaurant a lady. Other than that it was nice.
review.positiveRemarks: The room.
review.negativeRemarks: To clean the beach and keep the patio clean too because there were broken glass and a kid was playing around it.
review.locationRemarks: Everything was about 20 min. from where we were.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review! We appreciate your positive comments on our clean facilities, location, and the waterfront area. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future!

review.title: Great place near airport
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, clean, great lobby and waterfront area. Large, clean rooms. It was a bit pricy and WiFi and breakfast was extra. Was a bit far away from downtown but very convienant to airport.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, large rooms, great lobby and restaurent.
review.negativeRemarks: Include WiFi and breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Kind of far away from everything but airport. Had to take hotel shuttle to airport then Bart to downtown.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for taking the time to review the San Francisco Airport Marriott Waterfront. We sincerely apologize for the negative experience. You may be glad to know that the hotel is undergoing a renovation with new state of the art guest rooms. We hope that you will consider returning to our hotel so that we may offer you an experience up to par with the Marriott brand.

review.title: Airport Marriott - San Francisco
review.reviewText: $23 for self parking per day on top of $178 nightly rate. The lobby are looks decent, a small bottle of no name brand water $3.50 (Label states: "Source: Municipal water supply - go figure". No real closet in a bay view room - a divider metal sheet with a mirror and no top in the middle of the wall setup as a closet. "Thann" brand low quality, detergent like soap, shampoo etc... Wireless internet $13 per day. Carpet as thin as a blanket, can feel every groove on the floor. King size bed with 6 pillows, no comparison in comfort to other luxury brand name hotels. Eggs any style breakfast $11 - Just eggs. So, simply, low quality and rip off. The only good thing; distance from the SFO airport. 5 min.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for joining us! We are glad to know that you enjoyed your experience and we appreciate the recommendation. We hope to have the opportunity to serve you again in the future.

review.title: good hotel near sfo

review.title: nice hotel close to the airport

review.title: Hotel close to airport

review.positiveRemarks: Very nice, clean, high rise hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Location was very close to the airport so it made getting to the airport for our flight very convenient.

review.title: Good Visit
review.reviewText: First - all the hotel staff were superior - from the front desk, bellman, valets, resturant service, etc. Very friendly, and helpful. The room was pretty good, and nothing to complain about. I just wish this hotel, just like all hotels would have decent side chairs. They are not very comfortable and I dont like sitting on the bed.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, and service. I was also able to get a fantastic price from expedia which the front desk said was not one they had ever seen before.
review.negativeRemarks: It was rainy and the lobby floors got wet. Even though they were being tended to they were very slippery. The tile material is unsafe when wet.

Nice hotel. Great stay. I was sick and we have to stay for a long time in the hotel. Excellent facilities. Starbucks, super restaurants and bars downstairs. Beautiful view and walking path around the bay... You won't get bored.
A little disappointed with the extra fees : valet parking, internet, etc. No microwave in the room or access to it. I needed it because we had a little baby and needed to warm up her milk....
review.positiveRemarks: Bed super comfy, spacious room, nice location and facilities and the employees were amazing. Very nice

Room was nice, food wa good, although a bit limited, but fine for a business trip when y ou are only staying for one night or two.

Very satisfied

review.reviewText:
Your welcomed with smiley faces and easy check-in! The room is spacious enough for two people. However the bathroom is super small. Probably the smallest I've seen at a Marriott. You also have to pay $23.00 per night for parking. We ordered room service, I got the shrimp cocktail (4 pieces), he got a small meat lovers Pizza Hut pizza, no drinks, $32.00 and the pizza crust wasn't cooked all the way! We were starving, so he just ate it.
Our room was not on the "airport" side, so we didn't get the view. But did have a beautiful view of the garbage and recycle bins!!
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was comfortable and lots of pillows!!!
review.locationRemarks: Right next to airport. If you don't want to eat at the hotel, you need to drive a few minutes to get to any restaurants.

review.reviewText: This trip was all about my hubby. It was recommended that I stay outside of the city and it was a great choice! My hubby had a chance to see his team play at Candlestick for the last year and he was ecstatic! The ride from the game was my only complaint. (3 hours to go 8 miles!) The food, room and overall experience was wonderful.
review.positiveRemarks: This was the perfect spot! Only 8 miles from Candlestick! Enjoyed watching hte planes land over the Bay. The staff was everywhere to accomodate you!

The shore path is a real plus if you like to run or walk but it has several areas that are badly in need of repair so I wouldn't use it after dark.. Be aware that parking is not included in your room rate and for guests is $23/day. Overall I would stay here again and would recommend it to friends.

The guy at the counter said he would fix it and call us back that day to confirm the fix but we never heard back. It took almost a week after we left San Francisco before it was resolved.

review.title: Extremely friendly staff, very comfortable.
review.reviewText: There was a definite air of highly deferential service from all of the staff there. The room was very comfortable, and I loved its proximity to the shore, with a comfortable patio outside the cafÃ©. However, they overcharged for many things: parking was $23 per day for the "privilege" of keeping your car on their uncovered lot. There was a bottle of water in the room that will cost you $3.50 if you use it. They charge $12.95 per day for Internet access. I'm sure there are many other things for which they would gladly overcharge, but we didn't spend enough time there to find out.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were very friendly and helpful. The nearby shore is a plus.
review.negativeRemarks: Eliminate all the greedy nickel-and-diming for things that should be free. Or at least make the pricing more reasonable.
review.locationRemarks: Near to the airport. Joe's CafÃ© by the Bay was a great little restaurant for breakfast or lunch.

review.title: Expensive but the Marriott would be my choice
review.reviewText:
I began to think Marriott had something against me. We had stayed at the Marriott in Napa the night before and the room which was very expensive faced the parking lot . When we got to SF again a room next to the road and to add insult to injury next to the ice machine which ran all night.
DON'T let them put you in room 4032!
In Napa I put up with it in SF I didn't sleep the first night so asked to be switched which they did without question.
The new room was lovely and quiet.
The food is expensive but good not the usual hotel poorly cooked version. The bar is great for night caps and snacks.
Service was excellent.
review.positiveRemarks: Good Food(Expensive as all the other hotels in the area)
review.negativeRemarks: Placing clients in a nice room before they complain would be a step up.
review.locationRemarks: Location is great the Shuttle service was prompt both from and to the airport. Excellent place for a run it's right on the water across from SFO

review.title: Excellent experience
review.reviewText: The room felt very clean, bed very comfortable, and I'm finicky on both. Good strong coffee from the coffee maker, everything presented very nicely. Big terry bath robe in the closet. Starbucks in the lobby. Great food in the restaurant. Great view of the water and airport in my room. Every staff person SO nice! And if you're lucky, on the uppermost floors, you might hear a strange sound in the mid-evening, look out and find yourself face to heart-shaped face with an owl (and its mate), tilting its head a full 90 degrees in apparent fearless curiously. Even without the owl, I will definitely return there. (P.S., I'm a real consumer, not a shill.)

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: I work at Stanford for the summer and my wife flew into town for the weekend. We found a great deal for such a nice hotel on Expedia and it was the best decision. The hotel was fantastic. Service was amazing. Well worth the money.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was excellent. Very roomy and comfortable. The staff was amazing.
review.negativeRemarks: Don't charge $23 a day to park my car. I wasn't expecting that extra cost.

review.title: Will visit SF Marriott again
review.reviewText: Shuttle service was excellent, both during retrieval from SFO and return. We enjoyed a wonderful meal at the restaurant (one of the best during our entire trip) and were very comfortable in our room. There was no airport noise at all, even though you can sit in the restaurant or lounge and watch the continuous landings at SFO. There is a long trail along the bay next to the hotel so you can walk off the dinner. This is definitely a good place to rest before or after a long haul across the Pacific.
review.positiveRemarks: Zero complaints. Liked having a Starbucks in the lobby for quick caffeine. Comfortable lounge to drink coffee and read the WSJ on the Kindle.
review.negativeRemarks: Well, I wouldn't turn down a free foot rub service (but don't think anyone is offering that yet)
review.locationRemarks: Perfect. Easy access to the highway to reach SF or bridges across the Bay.

The hotel is very clean and comfortable with great views of the bay. the room was a little smaller than we expected, and the parking fee is just ridiculous. We couldn't believe they charged for parking even when you stay at the hotel!
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, beautiful views of the bay.

review.title: Exceptionally cordial and accodomodating staff.
review.reviewText: We spent the last night of our week-long vacation in the San Francisco Bay Area at the San Francisco Airport Marriott. We drove in from Monterey, CA and turned in our rental car. We were planning to secure our luggage with the concierge at the Marriott, hop on the BART (rail transportation), and complete our check list of "things to do" in San Francisco. BART had gone on strike that same morning and all service was suspended. We decided to just stay around the hotel, with transportation in the city being stressed to the max. Everyone, from the front desk, the concierge, the wonderful restaurant, and every employee wearing a Marriott name tag was cordial, answered our questions, chatted with us, and taught us that our claim to "Southern Hospitality" was also earned by these folks in California.
review.positiveRemarks: Besides the staff, I appreciated the clean and inexpensive laundry facility for guest use. Boxes of laundry and fabric softener were complimentary.
review.locationRemarks: I could not believe how incredibly quiet the room was, considering the proximity to the airport.

review.title: Perfect
review.reviewText: I am so happy choosing this hotel. Good location an excellent service.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff are wonderful
review.negativeRemarks: Reduce your parking rate
review.locationRemarks: No restaurant around.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText:
Check in 'clerk' was especially friendly and helpful. Comfortable lobby is attractive with a bright and pleasing atmosphere. excellent. But we were very disappointed that the Starbucks CafÃ© adjacent to the lobby was closed for long periods during some busy Sat & Sun daylight and evening hours. The lobby had very friendly and helpful cocktail/ food waiters/waitresses; appetizer foods offerings were fresh/good but they were expensive considering the very small servings.
We liked the view of the water and airport take-offs; and the walking paths along the waterfront to nearby local restaurants. We very much liked the courtesy shuttle to/from airport. We were very disappointed that after being told we could take advantage of the Business Center,-it was confusing to find at its temporary location on the third floor and then only to find that it was closed on the two days we were there: We only wanted to check email and print boarding passes.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience to airport and metro transportation; it's clean, attractive lobby area and very clean and comfortable rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Improved/expanded Starbuck CafÃ© (lobby) hours. PC/Internet accessibility at business center or in the lobby area for those who don't have a device.
review.locationRemarks: Recommend to future guests the Elephant Bar/Restaurant down the street: very good food and beverages!

review.title: A good place to stay!

Clean and quiet but missed having an in room refrigerator and safe. Room service was so fast and the food was good.
The pool was indoor so a little high in the chlorine smell but appreciated 6 am opening to have some time doing laps
alone.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and clean and quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: TV Channel said OWN- but it was a sports station- no Oprah!
review.locationRemarks: Good location!

review.title: Cheap room, expensive everything else
review.reviewText: I think that since this hotel is right next to the airport, they feel they can charge whatever prices they want for things such as parking, food, etc. The room was relatively inexpensive, but they end up making up for it, and before you know it, you've paid $250 for a hotel room 15 miles from the city, when you could have paid the same price for a hotel in the city. I live in Walnut Creek and sometimes it's just more convenient to stay in a hotel rather than drive back and forth all weekend when there are multiple days that I need to be there. But it's $23 for overnight guest parking, which even the front desk person admitted was steep. Then I paid $26 for chips and guacamole with a glass of wine because they feel the need to charge a 20% service fee at the bar. They know the tourists will pay, but it just feels like a slap in the face to us locals. I probably wouldn't stay here again unless there was a really good deal on the room.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was pretty comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom was a little outdated. Take off the 20% service charge, and lower the food prices.
review.locationRemarks: Do you love the smell of jet fuel in the morning? It is really close to the airport, and I could see staying here for business, but not for pleasure.

review.title: Great for families, couple or traveling alone.
review.reviewText:
Our experience was amazing. We have 5 kids so we booked adjoining rooms, which they were able to locate easily. And they gave us free parking (waived the $20 fee). The hotel interior, lobby and other areas, is really modern; you'd think it'd be old fashioned by looking at the exterior. I was surprised. We will definitely come back here on our next trip to San Francisco. They have a Starbucks in the lobby, very convenient.
Honestly, we didn't' do much at the hotel except for sleeping and watching some tv, but the beds were super comfortable and the overall atmosphere was great.

review.locationRemarks: It was easy to find.

review.title: PLEASANT STAY
review.reviewText: really enjoyed the staff , verry helpfull . the hotel was verry clean and service was good. would stay closer to down town san fran next time. all in alL verry nice stay , diff a 4 star+
review.positiveRemarks: STAFF VERRY NICE AND FRIENDLY
review.negativeRemarks: RELAXING
review.locationRemarks: EX LOCATION IF YOU WANTED TO BE 25 NIN FROM SAN FRAN.

review.title: Very comfortable!
review.reviewText: I loved this place so much! We've decided to come up once a quarter for a weekend get-away!
review.positiveRemarks: I love the atrium bar area, seating outside along the bay with a fire pit and cozy blankets to sit and sip a glass of wine while watching planes land.
review.negativeRemarks: No refrigerator in the room
review.locationRemarks: Close to SFO, but no airport NOISE!

review.title: Not close to anything, charge you for eveything
review.reviewText: I won't stay there again. It was difficult to commute to the city and I wasn't a fan of being nickled and dimed for everything.

review.title: Seemed tired.
review.reviewText: The front desk staff was generally efficient but dismissive and fairly unpleasant. The room furnishings were worn although the bed itself was very comfortable. The room also smelled of mold. I stayed in this hotel several years ago and had a very good experience but now I'd recommend one of the many other hotels near the airport in preference to this one.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable bed.
review.negativeRemarks: Unpleasant staff.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to the airport but be aware that their shuttle stops at two other hotels on the way so leave extra time.

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel with a great view off the planes arriving and taking off, but the water and shoreline were disappointing! Beautiful lobby and lounge area, very comfortable beds with great room service! Convently located close to the airport but very diffacult to get down town without a car or atleast expensive anyway! ( $55.00 oneway)
review.positiveRemarks: I loved watching the planes landing and taking off!
review.negativeRemarks: Our room was a very very long walk from the elevators!
review.locationRemarks: Great location for watching airplanes, but very bad for doing things in the down town area!

review.title: Summer vacations
review.reviewText:
Great location
Kind reception
Good menu but Ã  little expensive.
Clean rooms
Pet friendly
review.positiveRemarks: Location, clean rooms, kindness of staff

review.title: Wake up call
review.reviewText: I was sounds to sleep when the room next dor came in at night and were loud. I didn't call the front desk but it seemd other rooms were availalbe for these loud people. The wake up call was not made so thank God I was ujp anyway.
review.positiveRemarks: restaurant bar area
review.negativeRemarks: other guests next to my room
review.locationRemarks: close to the airport

review.title: Rude Staff
review.reviewText: Wholesale and confused operation with rude staff. Stay across the street at Hampton Inn. Front desk in particular made for an unpleasant stay. The hotel has a great location with regard to the airport but it is over priced for what it is to be frank.

review.title: Great sleep
review.reviewText:
The hotel is beautiful and the beds are so comfortable.I had a great seelp
It would have been great to have robes to put on after a shower.
The airconditioning was up way to hi gh in the hotel lobby/lounge. Also, the prices are expensive for food and drinks
review.positiveRemarks: The bed!!! Great sleep!
review.negativeRemarks: The prices and temperature
review.locationRemarks: Great location if you need to be by the airport and the shuttle is free and convient

review.title: Quick, but very comfortable stay
review.reviewText: We had to stay because of a missed connection after an overseas flight. Very close and convenient to airport, shuttle ran on exact schedule they said it would and the room was VERY comfortable!

review.title: Fun airport overnighter
review.reviewText: As a family of 4 we all loved this hotel as an over night stop. It was great fun being able to watch the planes land and take off. Bar/lounge area was lively and fun and we had a lovely meal in the restaurant. It is certainly going to be my preferred airport over nighter at San Fran. Room was a good size for the 4 of us too.
review.positiveRemarks: Lively bar/lounge area - watching planes take off and land. Good restaurant. Good sized family room
review.negativeRemarks: Small bathroom
review.locationRemarks: very convenient for airport with regular shuttle

review.title: Hotel near SFO
review.reviewText: Quiet hotel near the airport with a nice walking path right outside their doors. The shuttle service operates quite frequently, so getting there is easy.

review.title: Beautiful Views!
review.reviewText: This was my first time to the San Francisco area. I was extremely impressed with the hotel, the staff, the room, the view, and the food! I had trouble with the television upon check-in. When I called the desk, they sent a technician up within 5 minutes. The food was outstanding in the restaurant and every single staff member was attentive and polite. I will definately be back!

review.title: Best "Near Airport" Experience
review.reviewText: This was about as fine a near airport hotel I have experienced. The rate was reasonable and included breakfast. Hangar Steak restaurant in the hotel offered very good service and food.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Never had enough towels. A/C would not turn off. We were either freezing or burning up. Not convenient to downtown/sight seeing.

review.title: Great place to stay to sit and watch the planes land and take off!
review.reviewText: We were coming from a college football game and stayed for fleet week activities by the wharf area. The room was nice and comfy (corner room). Bathroom was a little small, they could have made the entry into the room smaller and given that area to the bath instead. The view to the bay was great. We got some coffee and sat in the room and watched the planes take off and land. The night we arrived we sat outside on the terrace by the fire pits and enjoyed the evening. The bar area has large windows and comfortable chairs to sit and relax. This is our second stay there and we plan on going back!

review.title: Convenient location to the airport, nice hotel overall
review.reviewText:
Very convenient if you want to be close to the airport.
Nice hotel, clean and very friendly staff

review.title: very clean
review.reviewText: very nice hotel,,,the price high ,,,but very clean

review.title: i will go back ,but not stay there again
review.reviewText: My review of my stay at the marriott waterfront was ok! What i didn't like about it was that,when i checked in the desk clerk wasn to friendly.Then when i get into my room the room had a mildew smell and the bed spread had like dried food or something on it,but overall the room was clean!the locations is good for as being close to the airport and thats all! A friend and i ate in the lounge and the service wasnt to good.You had to pay for breakfast,when breakfast should have been provide free of charge i would think! If i had to refer someone to stay there its depends on what they are looking! If convenience to aiport yes,but for anythig else no i wouldnt!

review.title: i like the view,Great!
review.reviewText: Its a very clean hotel and the swiming pool is great!!!!!!!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: I really liked this hotel because of the service and the location. The staff was always friendly and helpful. A couple of things I didn't like was that there is a 20% service charge when you order room service, plus they want you to give a tip. They also charge $20 each night to park there or $25 each night for Valet. We did Valet because it's more convenient but I think it's still pricey for both. Other than that, my husband and I really enjoyed staying at this hotel.

review.title: Great for between San Jose and San Francisco.
review.reviewText: If you are flying into San Francisco but doing business in San Jose, this is a great in between hotel. During down times you can travel to both and still enjoy.

review.title: Handy for airport
review.reviewText: Good shuttle bus service; useful laundry; otherwise standard Marriott service

review.title: Love the Lounge
review.reviewText: We enjoy are stay at the San Francisco Waterfront Marriott. The service was great and friendly.

review.title: super
review.reviewText: super

review.title: good hotel
review.reviewText: it was good

review.title: This will be my regular hotel!
review.reviewText:
This place is even more beautiful from the inside. Has a bar, pool, gym, gorgeous view, and I have to say the BEST service overall. Everyone was very polite and I definately felt like they cared. Seconds from the freeway and minutes from the city. Definately avoiding all the traffic. Love this
place!

review.title: A Relaxful Stay
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at the Mariott for the weekend. The staff was very kind and helpful. We were able to obtain a map of the city and received useful information for dining and evening activities. We also enjoyed relaxing outside by the fire and looking at the bay. The facilities was extremely clean and the atmosphere was comfortable. We will visit this hotel again when we come back to San Francisco.

review.title: the hotel is nice BUT service is not
review.reviewText: We booked 3 rooms and requested that the rooms are next to each other. When we arrived at the hotel they gave us rooms in 3 different floor and blamed Expedia for not communicating the request to them. I am not sure which fault is this but this caused huge dissapointment from our kids!!!!!

review.title: Excellent business travelerâ€™s hotel
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, comfortable rooms. If you are a business person needing a place near the airport, stay here.

review.title: Poor Management staff and Pool not working all week
review.reviewText:
Paid for 7 days hotel to have pool not working when I wanted to use it.
I told 3 staffs and no one cared to follow up with me.
Manager did not care about my concern.
Never going back.

review.title: Very Nice!
review.reviewText:
This was the least expensive hotel on our trip but the nicest of all. There is a beautiful view of the bay and airport from our hotel window as well as the lounge and restaurant. Excellent food. Nice walk on the bay and around the hotel.

This was the last night of our 9 day vacation and I lost my camera at the hotel with all of our pictures. Much to my relief they found it and mailed it back. Good people. Everybody else I told said the camera was gone for good!

review.title: Ok for an overnight stop .....
review.reviewText:
The hotel is fine for an overnight between flights. Free parking. Nice downstairs. The only downsides we experienced were:
- our room had previously been smoked in, so a lot of the soft furnishings smelled of smoke
- the noise from aircraft taking off was quite noisy but it is an airport hotel! So thats the price you pay for the concenient location

review.title: San Francisco Bayside Marriott
review.reviewText: Nice lobby bar and restaurant. Beautiful waterside walkway to watch the planes land across the bay.

review.title: it was ok
review.reviewText: nothing extraordinary, just ok, but the price was great

review.title: Love this Hotel
review.reviewText: This was my second stay at this Marriott, and it was excellent. The facilities are immaculate and all of the staff are very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Marriott SFO Airport
review.reviewText: The Marriott at San Francisco airport is very conveniently located near the airport and many key businesses in south San Francisco. It also has comfortable rooms most with a bay view and the food is excellent. I am a regular visitor and the recent upgrades to the lobby area cater to internet access, informal meeting spaces and people to bring food and drinks if needed. Excellent destination spot!

review.title: San Francisco Airport Marriott
review.reviewText: My only complaint was the Internet wasn't free, in fact I thought it was quite expensive. When you pay a lot of money for a room, Internet should come free. That said, the room was great and so was the hotel service.

review.title: best hotel in amsterdam
review.reviewText: wonderful hotel. Ive stayed at many hotels in amsterdam, and this was the best. The restaurant was a bit snobby and the food not so good, but that goes for most hotels in the world. I will be staying here every time i am in amsterdam

review.title: Very nice airport hotel
review.reviewText: This is a very nice hotel. I was surprised at how quiet it was despite its proximity to the airport. There is a beautiful view of planes landing and taking off from open space lobby area. The staff was very helpful with everything. The only issue I had was my inability to return a room key. I had to use it to leave the guest parking lot and they said there was a return box but I could not locate it. Otherwise, it was a very pleasant stay!

review.title: Solid Choice
review.reviewText: Never have to worry about this place. Great value. Great food and drinks. Great service. Very reliable with a great view of the bay and airport.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText:
We really liked this hotel and will stay at it on our next trip to San Francisco. The room was large with a very comfortable bed and it was extremely quiet. The hotel was in excellent condition. The rooms have excellent views of the water (and also the airport depending on what side you are on).
The hotel provides a free shuttle back and forth to SFO which is very handy. From SFO you can either catch a flight out or take BART into San Francisco. Bart is $8.10 and approx 35 minutes to Moscone or 45 to Fisherman's Wharf connecting with the trolley.
The only downside to the hotel is the parking. Parking is around $35 per day - about the same amount as parking overnight in downtown San Francisco (which is a pain). First 30 minutes is free.
Free shuttle to the airport starts at 4:30 in the morning and stops at the other hotels. Other hotels evidently all share a shuttle. There was only one other stop between this hotel and SFO. SFO is extremely busy early in the morning with flights to the east coast. So, if you have a 6 am flight you'll want to leave around 4 am which will thus require a cab. We barely made our 6:00 am flight on a Sunday because the airport was so busy!

review.title: Only if you have no other options
review.reviewText: This was one of the worst expensive hotel rooms that I have ever stayed in. The room was the equivalent of a slightly upgraded Motel6.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Lobby and check-in were fine as expected. The room however was much less than expected. Small and older in it fit and finish, small bathroom -- you know, the kind where you can't have the door open without it nearly hitting the john. Upon entry, the HVAC or probably better yet the "swamp cooler" made the room smell damp and dank like the cabin of a small boat. It was hard to breath in the room and the windows were screwed shut, no relief. There's nowhere in the neighborhood to eat so you're captured and the food prices in the lobby cafe reflected it. It did have a Starbucks in the lobby but was poorly stocked with pastries and no sandwiches. The shuttle bus to and from the airport was nice and fast so that's a plus. There are a bunch of other hotel along the water next to SFO so I'll probably try another before I come back here. The plane crews all seem to stay at the Hyatt...

review.title: Excellent quality, handy to the airport, free shuttle
review.reviewText: Good quality, free shuttle to the airport, free shuttle to the BART and transportation downtown. Highly recommended.

review.title: SF Hotel
review.reviewText: Travel experience was great however the room was ok besides one of the queen beds, it was like a "ditch" parents were not comfortable all night, turning around and around for several hours.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Room was clean and there were no problems with anything. Food was pricy! Clam chowder in bar was the best thing we ate! Breakfast was good too. We would stay again. Didn't have much of a view, but the view from outside or the bar are really nice.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: This was our second trip back to San Franciso and stayong at the Marriott. My mother and I wanted to be in a room near my sister and neice, we were do so with no problem. We were offered extras because of the issuse. The staff was very nice and did everything to satisfy our needs. They were outstanding....

review.title: satisfied
review.reviewText: great location, good service and clean rooms

review.title: Netsu
review.reviewText: Nice hotel.

review.title: Marriot SFO Airport
review.reviewText: It was a nice stay. I like the room, loby, and view from the hotel. I'll stay at the same hotel whenever I visit SFO.

review.title: Mediocre
review.reviewText: Very average, doesn't deserve it's 4-Star rating.

review.title: A bed i'd go back for
review.reviewText:
The bed was fantastic, I slept like a baby!
the location was kind of far away from any shopping & only a couple of restaurants to choose from ( both with good food).. A $20 cab ride to San Mateo or a $40-50 ride to San Francisco if you don't have a car.

review.title: Marriott San Francisco Airport - Great Convention location
review.reviewText: This property was very nice and the airport shuttle was very convenient. There were a few problems at check in, but nothing that would deter me from staying there again. The staff was friendly and helpful with directions and arraigning cabs.

review.title: airport hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, cool view of the water and airport with a bar to sit and watch planes come and go. Room was very nice and comfortable. Only complaint would be that in this day and age I think wireless internet should be free.

review.title: Airport Marriot
review.reviewText: Great lobby with a wonderful view from the bar. The steak restaurant in the hotel was excellent.

review.title: Close to SFO!
review.reviewText: Very nice, clean, conviently-located hotel near SFO (with shuttle service to airport).

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Just like any Marriott we stayed before. One disappointed incident was that our son left his stuff animal in the bed. We called the hotel; but they couldn't recover it for us. The sentimental value is immeasurable. It is the stuff animal that my son brings wherever he goes. He was quite sad about this.

review.title: Talk about convenience!
review.reviewText: Shuttle to Marriott was close, timely & very convenient. Check in swift & accommodations were just perfect.

review.title: Fantastic Hotel
review.reviewText: Really pleased we found it on Expedia

review.title: Pleasant View
review.reviewText: The hotel was very comfortable with pleasant, helpful staff. My only complaint was the lack of food services outside the hotel which is out of the hotel's responsibility. The prices for breakfast were very high.

review.title: Nice accommodations
review.reviewText: Room and property was very nice and clean. Restaurant prices were extremely high.

review.title: san francisco
review.reviewText: san francisco and the marriott-a great vacation package

review.title: very nice hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: the hotel was very nice and staff at front desk exceptional, going to downtown San Francisco was easy , hotel shuttle bus to international terminal and then BART train to Powell street placed me in the heart of the city and shopping. this trip can take 45m minutes to 1 hour. the hotel is close to airport if you only intend short stay its the best location

review.title: Overnight stay
review.reviewText: When we arrived at the hotel (@ 6pm) we were told our deluxe bay view room on the 6th floor wasn't ready. However, they did have a "similar" room on the second floor we could have for the same price. That seemed OK and we were tired from traveling all day, so we took it. What they failed to mention was that the second floor was booked for a large wedding reception. We had to wade through a crowd of people spilling out of the ballroom to get to the corridor our room was on while avoiding rolling over formal gowns with our luggage. Once getting to the room we discovered that the "Bay View" was looking at the jogging path out back with some bay view of planes approaching SF airport. The wedding party left by midnight taking the music and crowd with them leaving us in silence. The bed was comfortable; the cable channel selection was OK if you wanted to watch all the ESPN and cable news stations and not much else. Also, the in-room bottled water is $4 each, and there were no vending machines on our floor. Oh, and it costs $10 to park in their lot overnight - which is probably a deal for SF.

review.title: Convenient business conference site
review.reviewText: Easy place to stay near the airport - great airport shuttle service; friendly staff; great room.

review.title: Marriott San Francisco Airport
review.reviewText: The location to the airport was nice. The building was clean and tidy. The room we reserved was a long way from the elevator. I was surprised that there were not elevators located at other parts of the building. Our room was clean and nice. But a few things were wrong. There was only one mirror in the bathroom and no vent fan. This allowed the mirror to fog a lot and also caused the extra toilet paper to get soggy. When it came time to replace the toileet paper roll, the dispenser bar was broken and would not fit back into the bar. No one fixed it and the toilet paper rested ont he counter the remainder of our trip. Another mirror over the desk would have been nice. The parking cost us $18 per night instead of being included in our bill. Also, we tried to rent an on demand movie. It charged our room but wouldn't play. We called the desk and they refunded our money but said that not all movies shown are available. That seemed a bit unprofessional to me. If the movie is not available, they should take it off the menu. Staff was friendly and helpful. Beds were clean each day. Overall, it was just ok. Would not stay there again though.

review.title: Marriott near SFO Airport
review.reviewText: My fiance and I were very pleased with our room. The parking fees were a bit too much, but to be expected. It was very freeway close. The staff there was very friendly and helpful. We would definitely recommend the hotel to others.

review.title: An OK hotel but I will be unlikely to go back
review.reviewText: The room and the bathroom are very small and could use some upgrades. The window was very dirty during our stay. The tiny,indoor swimming pool has what seemed like salt water. At least that was the feeling/taste you would get from swimming in the ocean. For me the only good thing was that it is located on a good location along the shoreline, next to the airport and the kids loved watcing planes taking off and landing while having breakfast there.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Good Place

review.title: Service disappointment
review.reviewText: The hotel came up to my expectations with the exception of the service in the lounge which was "poor", i was served relatively quickly, however when it came time to settle my tab I could not catch teh eye of my server. I finally stopped another server who said that they would alert my waiter. I noticed that they alerted my server right away but it still took almost 10 minutes to get my bill. it was not that busy.

review.title: Convient to location I was at.
review.reviewText: I enjoyed the service and convience to the location I was visiting

review.title: Small and Tiny.....
review.reviewText: When we arrived we thought WOW......valet, check in, everything seemed perfect. However, they gave us a room without our request and extra expense of the Bay View so we had to go back down. The window to the Bay was so dirty you could hardly see out of it. The bathroom was so small and tiny..... the room itself was so small.....won't stay there again even though the employees were outstanding!! The room service was delicious and the location was superb......Sorry......

review.title: Great staff
review.reviewText: I was very impressed by the friendliness of the hotel staff. I always received a greeting from every member of the staff. The room itself was very nice including the very comfortable bed and pillows.

review.title: Felt like home away from home
review.reviewText: I stayed at the hotel while recovering from major surgery done at Palo Alto. My stay lasted for a week. This hotel provide myself and my sister a lot of comfort away from home. The view of the bay certainly helps sooth an aching body, the bay walk path, provided us with much needed leisure walking grounds, and it was very safe. It was amazing to be able to see planes landing and taking off from the room of the hotel or the lobby at any time of day. The Star Bucks inside the premises was ana extra bonus. The breakfast buffet was a plus. I had a rental car, they charge 18$/day to self park, parking spots are always available. Or you can go valet for 24$/day.The only thing I would improve? The Hangar restaurant meals i.e dinner tasted like cardboard, especially the steak and baked potato. And it was not worth the exorbitant price charged. Fire the chef, for sure!

review.title: Convenient, clean, great service
review.reviewText: a bit on the pricey side for an airport hotel, but very satisfied with everything else

review.title: Superb Room, Superb Service
review.reviewText: Excellent service and excellent food--as always. I travel for a living and I highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Much Better than Expected
review.reviewText: I had a conference in the hotel so I chose it for convenience. The 3 1/2 star user rating had me a bit concerned, but it turned out to be a very nice hotel. I strongly recommend it. You can also take a nice walk along the bay (not really scenic but it is convenient).

review.title: Great proximity to SFO airport
review.reviewText: The transportation to the airport was very reliable.

review.title: Great hotel by the airport
review.reviewText: Great view for drinks. Walking distance to casual restaurants.

review.title: not worth the money i paid for!
review.reviewText: i checked in in this hotel with my 18 month old daughter. i say, from the amount i paid, it was not worth it. i wish i just stayed at some other cheaper hotels. i felt a bit ripped off. if you are just staying for the night and want to be near the airport, just stay in another hotel nearby that is cheaper because i dont think there's really any difference. there is free shuttle but i am sure other cheaper hotels offer that too. the pool is not that appealing too!

review.title: Very good for the money.
review.reviewText: This is the second time I've stayed at this hotel. I particularly appreciate the fast shuttle service to and from the airport and the courtesy of the staff. Breakfast was good and quickly served, with a wonderful view of the harbor from the breakfast room. I'll make this my regular stopping place when I need a hotel near the San Francisco airport.

review.title: Comfortable Business/Airport Hotel
review.reviewText: Within 10 minutes of San Francisco International (30 on the return trip) by free airport shuttle, this hotel is functional, comfortable and a pleasant place to stay for a few days. I spent my time here at a conference, and things ran smoothly, bed was very comfortable, staff were friendly and efficient. The food was over-complicated, meaning snacks were an effort and expensive, but the restaurant food (eg. Filet mignon) was really very good. Beware the "Bay View" rooms are also "Runway View" rooms, so don't really warrant the premium. You may find yourself a long walk from the elevators too, but don't let that put you off.

review.title: Good Choice
review.reviewText: This hotel is a good choice if you need to stay overnight near the airport. The free shuttle to and from the terminals was great. There is also a Starbucks in the lobby.

review.title: no windows
review.reviewText: very good and efficient,no complaints BUT these hotels should have any kind of window in the rooms to let some air in,these sealed rooms are relatively dry from the air conditioners and not healthy,stuffed-up sinuses.

review.title: Will go back soon
review.reviewText: Everything at the hotelwas great, except the grill restaurant. Waiters,etc. forgot to serve all that was ordered in the breakfast, but the view was terrific. Wish that the use of the computer was free, as it is at some other hotels. The shuttle driver and service to and from the airport were outstanding.

review.title: Close to the airport but dated and slow room service
review.reviewText: The hotel has a great view and proximity but the guest service for items not in the room took nearly an hour. Hotel is old as are the bathrooms.

review.title: Hallways Confusing- Walk half a mile to Your Room
review.reviewText: My business partner and I kept getting lost in the many different hallways. They make no sense at all in their configuration.

review.title: good property in transition
review.reviewText: marriott is working hard on upgrading the public space in this hotel, so there is some construction going on. however, it did not affect the quality of our stay. we enjoyed the convenience of its location.

review.title: Great hotel...but avoid it currently due to construction (11/07)
review.reviewText: Rooms were great...comfortable, clean,roomy. Entrance, 1st floor, lobby and bar were all under construction which threw everyone for a loop. Staff was working very, very hard to accomodate...but it was difficult to enjoy our stay...due to the fact that this was a large hotel and the quest population didn't have enough space to spend their leisure time. Without the lobby and bar...this overcrowded the restaurant(s) and the make-shift bar... poorly positioned and staffed...people were forced to be 'herded', or stay in their rooms or stand outside (on a cold night that we were there)! If I had known this, I would have stayed somewhere else !

review.title: Ideal Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is right by the water, with a walkway that goes along the shore. You can see airplanes taking off and landing, but not be bothered by their noise. The problem was that the hotel was under renovation, which I did not know until I got there. I should have guessed by the price, being the cheapest in its category of 4-star hotels.

review.title: Pleasant Experience
review.reviewText: Although their was construction in the lobby and other public areas, noise and disruption were kept to a minimum and I was not inconvenienced. A mishap in the Dining Room was quickly rectified and breakfast was comped by the Manager. Lovely views!

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: The hotel is going to be beautiful when finished, currently under remodel. Room was on bay side, great views, comfortable, quiet, clean. Staff was very helpful in all areas. Used the cafe for breakfast, excellent food and service. I recommend this hotel for both business and leisure trips.

review.title: Beautiful Setting
review.reviewText: While the rooms were recently updated the bathroom need some extra care. During my two day stay the bathroom door had dirt and what appeared to be blood on the edge and face of the door. There was mold on the tile in the tub/shower area. Bed and appointments were comfortable and adequate.

review.title: Very Satisfied
review.reviewText: Was very satisfied with this hotel. My only complaint is that they should take time out to set a room up for the number of guests. I had 2 adults and 2 children and found it an inconvenience to get ready for showers when we received a towel and washcloth for 1 person. They did a great job getting extras to us.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: it was very good hotel

review.title: Happy landing
review.reviewText: Nice accomodations, served up well, in a refreshing setting; best breakfast-room atmosphere, opening onto red flowers, bay breeze and wading white ibis, I can recall stateside. Even the parking, full to the brim by 2 am, managed to redeem itself with a hidden space and the graciousness of the night guard. Realizing birds and moon not guaranteed, still a solid counterbalance to the current airline farragoes.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: The first room we had something was poking thur the mattress pad. We moved to another room which was much better.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: I stayed in a room whose walls were "paper thin", so much so you could hear the conversation in the next room and their use of the bathroom. Also, bathroom plumbing started gurgling during the night and woke me up. Very unimpressive and would never stay there again.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: This was my first stay at this hotel, and I travel a lot to this area. The hotel is very convenient for anyone flying in to SFO, being close to the airport, and offers hotel shuttle service to and from the airport. This is quite convenient if you want to take the BART into the city as well. The hotel is lovely and the room was beautiful and immaculate. Service was great. Restaurant offers buffet breakfast starting early which is convenient. My only suggestions would be to call the hotel for a shuttle if you arrive after 11:30pm, and expect a wait that late at night. Otherwise shuttles come pretty frequently routinely. Also I had a room on the same floor near the meeting rooms, and it so happened a party was scheduled in a meeting room one night of my stay. Some of the noise did carry to my room, and lasted until midnight. You might inquire about room locations and scheduled events to avoid this problem. Otherwise, the hotel gets my highest recommendations.

review.title: Beautiful view of Bay; Ok for overnight at San Fran airport.
review.reviewText: We found the room perfect: clean, very comfy bed, just what we wanted after a 6 hr plane flight from Hawaii. We just wanted to have a decent meal at the JR Steakhouse, but they closed at 10 and we arrived at 10:05 and they would not seat us. That was very disappointing. So we ate bar food, not our favorite, in a big open space. OK, but we needed a warm cozy place to relax and prepare for the next day flight of 6 more hours and we could not find it.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: I found it somehow dissapointing that there was no extra (magnifying) mirror available and the size of complimentary toiletries not big enough for two persons. We were staying just one short night before taking off to europe, arrived in the evening from Palm Spring with all the luggage carefully packed and were not prepered to search trough our cases to find extra shower gel and shampoo, specialy that these items are not allowed in hand luggage these days

review.title: Good hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: The Marriott provided easy access to the 101 and airport. Since I needed to be up and down the Silicon Valley and in the city, ariving late and leaving early the convience was great. No noise issues either.

review.title: Was good.
review.reviewText: The beds were very comfortable. Rooms and lobby were clean. Location was convenient to get off and on the interstate.

review.title: Great place to stay by the airport
review.reviewText: Convenient shuttle runs to SFO every 10 minutes in the morning. Friendly staff, great rooms and very quiet.

review.title: No complaints
review.reviewText: Great features: a completely non-smoking, clean, friendly hotel; dependable complementary shuttle service (about 10 minutes' ride) to and from the airport for access to public transportation into the city; comfortable beds and pillows; no charge for an extra rollaway bed; a Starbucks and plenty of seating in the atrium where you can order a meal from the restaurant; lovely sunrise view of the bay from the room and the atrium; well-insulated rooms where you can watch planes take-off and land at the airport across the bay without hearing them. Not so great feature: Location....Once the shuttle gets you to the airport, it takes about 20 minutes on the metro to get to the city. If you're going to spend much time in San Francisco, a downtown hotel may save you time and public transportation fees.

review.title: Great!
review.reviewText: Would like to have refrigerators in the rooms.

review.title: most comfortable bed yet
review.reviewText: I actually went online afterwards to price it because I wouldn't mind owning it. The free shuttle to the airport was nice as well.

review.title: Beautiful Location
review.reviewText: Very well maintain hotel. Beds were really comfortable. Over all the hotel was very good.

review.title: can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Great Hotel, we go to San Francisco every year and so far this has been the best stay.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: I stayed here for 2 nights in August, 06. Everything was up to my expectations. Staff was very curtious and helpful. I used the complimentaty suttle to connect with the BART and was able to get anywhere I needed or wanted to go. Bayside windows allowed a nice view of air traffic coming and going. The windows could have been cleaned. I enjoyed the walking path at sunrise.

review.title: Terrific hotel....would stay there again.
review.reviewText: Only complaint is having to pay for internet usage.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Nice staff, nice clean hotel

review.title: Expedia Price was worth it and more
review.reviewText: This is truely a 4 star hotel with all of the amenities. On my last morning the staff made a mistake and pushed the bill for the room next to mine under the door and this was one time that the Expedia deal got me a luxery room at half price. I stayed 3 days and was well satisfied. The room service, gift shop and hotel restaurants are spendy. It is a long walk to fastfood or anything for that matter. I had to pay $20 a day for parking (valet) but self-park was still $17. My family and I were treated like royalty-It is worth it once in awhile.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The walk of at least 400 yards to a room with a view of the roof was great I need to walk more!! The room would not cool down, even though we set the temp at 60 degrees with the fan on high. The parking rate at $17.50 was too much, cut it in half, $ 8.00 would be more like it, or better yet would be to up the cost of the rooms by $8.00 and do away with the parking charge. The people in the gift shop were great, and the American Grill was very good too.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Things I liked: Location, on the edge of SF Bay with wonderful views in every direction. Walking path along the bay. I could watch airplanes land at SFO but they were far enough away I could not hear them. Deep breaths and stretching my legs drained all my tension away. Breakfast, a vegetarian omelet with coffee and orange juice. I can still taste the great orange juice. Room, a quiet clean room, all to myself. Lighting, this may seem wierd but I'm into lighting. I'm a lighting designer. The lighting design in this hotel is very good.

review.title: Super service at a super location!
review.reviewText: The hotel is about 1 mile from the airport and offers a free shuttle which i found to be reliable and it runs all night ( but the BART stops at 12midnight ). We were well looked after and all the hotel workers weremore than happy to help as regrads to info. Using BART expect about a 30min ride to downtown SF. Make sure you check out pier 39! WOW!

review.title: Everything was great except...
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel with great service and amenities. The only problem was that the hotel did not offer a discount for overnight parking in their onsite parking lot. Guests pay full price.

review.title: Marriott at SFO
review.reviewText: The hotel was excellent with an excellent location, easy access to the airport and a fantastic walking trail on the waterfront

review.title: Simple honeymoon
review.reviewText: Staff allowed us to sleep in and take a late checkout -- no free champagne to greet us, but we got a lovely view of the San Francisco Bay to wake up to.

review.title: Good hote for overnight staysl, small bathrooms
review.reviewText: Nice hotel for overnight stay while in transit or for business travelers to either San Facisco or San Jose areas.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Very noisy as you can easily hear your nabor talking, bathroom, shower, corridor etc.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: This was our first trip in quite some time, the hotel was wonderful, we enjoyed our stay there tremendously, We definately recommend this hotel, it was very comfortable and the view was amazing!!

review.title: A bit from the city, but offered an excellent rate!
review.reviewText: I can honestly say that I didn't get a "Four Diamond" or four star feel from my room or the service at this hotel. The lobby was immaculate, but our very expensive dinner in the steakhouse was very disappointing, they failed to have the champagne waiting in our room (as had been prearranged and paid), we had long waits for car valet service on several days, our non-smoking room was directly across the hall from smoking rooms which made no sense to me at all. Overall our room was not befitting a four star hotel - in my opinion. It was a tremendous value for our rate though, and they did remove the restaurant charge from our bill without us asking, so they redeemed themselves somewhat with that service.

review.title: The best hotel at the San Francisco Airport
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel and great location

review.title: Okay
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel was okay but had few negatives. Have to pay for parking, internet, water in the room, no continental breakfast. I have stayed in much cheaper hotel with all these facilities which comes free for the hotel guest.

review.title: First Class All the Way
review.reviewText: Hotel staff and facilities are the best

review.title: Nice place to Stay
review.reviewText: Clean, nice view and friendly staff

review.title: Unhappy with service
review.reviewText: Don't expect this hotel to go out of its way for you. Also, the hotel charges for parking in their own lot, which is never full. In my opinion, that is not okay. Especially since the hotel is not cheap. Also, don't expect the maid service to replenish your bath amenities if you stay over for three or four days. They are skimpy with that, too.

review.title: Great all around experience
review.reviewText: All of the Hotel employees were extremely helpful and super nice!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel. What stood out most was the hospitality of the staff. They were always very friendly and helpful!!!

review.title: Best airport hotel
review.reviewText: Only a public path separates this hotel from the bay - and that path is mostly used by other hotel guests for walking and jogging. From the lobby and restaurant you have a perfect view of (some of) the runways of the SFO airport without the noice. Night sights include the lights on the San Mateo bridge. Choice at the menu is very traditional - same goes for the breakfast buffet - but waiters are courteous though some of them seemed somewhat exhausted/fatigued during my stay. For at hotel that close to the bay it would be nice to be able to open a window in the room!!

review.title: Great time at SFO Mariott
review.reviewText: This is a great way to save some money and still stay in a nice hotel. It's right on the water and very well maintained. Parking is $17/night which I thought was still a bit expensive, but a far cry from the $35-$45/night in the city. It's only about a 15 minute drive to the city... . We will definitely be staying here again, as far as I'm concerned it's a much better deal and way more convenienent than any place we've stayed in the city.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Great location, just a short hop to San Francisco. Try to get a room with a view of the bay... you'll enjoy watching the planes touchdown just over the water!

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Beatiful view of the bay. Very convenient and easy to find. Just one exit away from the airport. The hotel has a car rental office which ultimately will save you lots of time if you're in a hurry.

review.title: Very relaxing
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean, staff was friendly, beds where very comfortable, location was nice, view of the airplanes and next to the water.

review.title: Works for me
review.reviewText: Good quality for what i wanted.Would return

review.title: Central spot for our stay
review.reviewText: Great property for leisure or business. We were in the area for events at Stanford and Cal Berkeley and chose this hotel due to the central location. Our rooms were nice but a bit small. The beds were very soft, which some may not like. We enjoyed the bar/lounge area as the staff was very friendly. Nice workout room with hot tub and indoor pool. We were worried about being close to the airport, but honesty did not even hear the planes from inside the hotel.

review.title: Convenient location, clean, helpful staff
review.reviewText: The Marriott was a good place to stay and a great value for the price we paid. The fitness room is well-kept and has better equipment than found at most hotels in the area. Our meals were reasonably priced and the quality good. The service at the restaurant was excellent. The walking path behind the hotel is a fun place to walk, jog or roller blade. The children liked the views of the bay and the airport runways.

review.title: Great Location!!
review.reviewText: This hotel is a great hotel if planning to stay near the airport.  Beautiful views of the bay to watch airplanes come in.  The park that runs next along the bay is very nice and clean!  Great place to stay.  Easy access to the BART and Caltrain.  I stayed by the airport and worked and played in SFO!  Great place!!

review.title: Very Enjoyable
review.reviewText: The location is very nice.  The view of the Bay is beautiful and the walking bath along the bay makes it all the more enjoyable.  The seafood chowder in the restaurant was wonderful.  No complaints here.

review.title: S.F.'s best hotel near by airport
review.reviewText: I would like to stay closer to fisherman's warf next time when I go to S.F.

review.title: "Would definitely stay here again"
review.reviewText: The staff at this hotel were very friendly as well as helpful. They made us feel as though our every wish would and could be granted.  The room was clean and spacious. Room service was great! The only thing negative about the hotel was that we had a room with a view of the airport and the bay which was truly beautiful.  The only draw back was the location of the elevators. It's a long walk to the elevators, especially if you like to shop!

review.title: parking
review.reviewText: When we were checking in we were never told at that time that wewould have to pay $17.00 a day for parking. I was never told when I conformed my reservations. I believe that We should have been told ahead of time.

review.title: Great place.
review.reviewText: Awesome service.
